item.title: Ginny add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Ginny add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "People in their right minds never take pride in their talents." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "Perhaps the logical conclusion of everyone looking the same is everyone thinking the same." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ginny add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "To be, or not to be: that is the question: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune, Or to take arms against a sea of troubles, And by opposing end them? To die: to sleep; No more; and by a sleep to say we end The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks That flesh is heir to, 'tis a consummation Devoutly to be wish'd. To die, to sleep; To sleep: perchance to dream: ay, there's the rub; For in that sleep of death what dreams may come When we have shuffled off this mortal coil, Must give us pause: there's the respect That makes calamity of so long life; For who would bear the whips and scorns of time, The oppressor's wrong, the proud man's contumely, The pangs of despised love, the law's delay, The insolence of office and the spurns That patient merit of the unworthy takes, When he himself might his quietus make With a bare bodkin? who would fardels bear, To grunt and sweat under a weary life, But that the dread of something after death, The undiscover'd country from whose bourn No traveller returns, puzzles the will And makes us rather bear those ills we have Than fly to others that we know not of? Thus conscience does make cowards of us all; And thus the native hue of resolution Is sicklied o'er with the pale cast of thought, And enterprises of great pith and moment With this regard their currents turn awry, And lose the name of action.--Soft you now! The fair Ophelia! Nymph, in thy orisons Be all my sins remember'd!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Avril Lavigne
item.description: "Her feelings she hides Her dreams she can't find She's losing her mind She's falling behind She can't find her place She's losing her faith She's falling from grace She's all over the place" -- Avril Lavigne

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ginny add a quote by ابوالقاسم فردوسی / Abolghasem Ferdowsi
item.description: "جهانا سراسر فسوسی و باد بتو نیست مرد خردمند شاد" -- ابوالقاسم فردوسی / Abolghasem Ferdowsi

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Stanisław Lem
item.description: "We have no need of other worlds. We need mirrors. We don't know what to do with other worlds. A single world, our own, suffices us; but we can't accept it for what it is." -- Stanisław Lem

item.title: Ginny add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Albus Severus," Harry said quietly, so that nobody but Ginny could hear, and she was tactful enough to pretend to be waving to Rose, who was now on the train, "you were named for two headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin and he was probably the bravest man I ever knew." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Ginny add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Ginny add a quote by ابوالقاسم فردوسی / Abolghasem Ferdowsi
item.description: "I am deathless, I am the eternal Lord For I have spread the seed of the Word." -- ابوالقاسم فردوسی / Abolghasem Ferdowsi

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Ginny add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Scott Westerfield
item.description: "The human heart is a strange vessel. Love and hatred can exist side by side." -- Scott Westerfield

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Tite Kubo
